intro: Auricula-ursi clusiana, commonly known as the alpine strawberry, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has dark green, leathery leaves and produces edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and medicinal properties, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies.
